newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares close lower in nervous trade.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares close lower in nervous trade.

text.p: Share prices closed sharply lower on the Delhi Stock Exchange following nervous selling by speculators anxious over former prime minister P.V. Narasimha Rao's court case, brokers said.
The bourse's benchmark index closed 15.73 points lower at 679.83.
Traders said lower Bombay Stock Exchange trends had a dampening affect on the share prices in Delhi. The Bombay sensex closed 98.41 points, or 3.17 percent, down at 3002.86.
"Market was full of different rumours on former prime minister Rao's case which was up for hearing in the Delhi High court today," said Suresh Aggarwal of brokers Jaimata Securities.
Rao on Monday won a brief respite as the Supreme Court reserved a decision in a criminal "cheating" case in which he has been summoned by a Delhi court to testify.
Delhi high court judge S.K. Mahajan said until he rules on Tuesday or Wednesday, a warrant for Rao's arrest issued last Friday would continue to be temporarily suspended.
Larsen and Toubro lost 10.75 rupees to close at 214.25 on heavy selling by speculators and financial institutions, brokers said.
State Bank of India fell 13.65 rupees to 217.50, while TISCO quoted 6.70 rupees lower at 165.20.
Hindustan Lever fell 15 rupees to 765 and Reliance Industries was down 3.40 rupees to 187.60.
